intro: Androscepia barteri, commonly known as the Barter's androsace, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a hairy surface, adapted to the cool, moist environments it inhabits. Androscepia barteri is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in shaded to partially shaded conditions.
